title: Who is the most important person in a band? - Quora

response.answer_text: Not a romantic notion exactly, but my experience shows it’s the member with a vision of what the band intends to achieve. You hear the term, “shared vision” sometimes….when you have it, you will be pulling together. I do believe a leader/administrator is necessary for lasting success. Leadership may not even be named, may be reluctant or even accidental, but is absolutely a requirement. It’s a sobering political reality, but a direction and goals are important parts of any banded ensemble. Often these goals are esoteric and unfocused, but at least present a path. Players are generally equal in my view, if they are all competent at their jobs. If a certain band member is so enormously talented as to overshadow the other players, the concept of a band is in jeopardy from the get go, unless the vision is to be a backup band for this individual. We’re dealing with egos here, and it’s not easy to do and it’s harder to maintain, but it’s how successful outfits manage to stay together.

Depends on the band in question. In some bands, pretty much everything depends on one person. They write the music, play it, sing, etc. And even if they don’t necessarily write every part, they’ve got the “drive” or “vision” to create the material, get gigs, build an audience, etc. But in some bands things are more more collaborative, with various duties spread over more than one person, and the band can’t do what it does with any members replaced.
